AMAZING! I completely loved the story and immersion. The environment, the character design/voices/personality, EVERYTHING is amazing about this game. If you love creative puzzles, this game will certainly keep you on your toes and no two tests are the same. Everything feels new and different in every level as you progress. The humor is nice too lol
Its fun.

A perfect uptake to the portal series giving the Portal Universe a really good dishing out of background about how the aperture testing facility came about. I can only wish they come up with a concept for Portal 3, queue something to do with the multiverse?!

It's a little late for this review, but here goes...  I grew up playing Atari.  No other kind of video game has ever really caught my attention...until Portal.  I was introduced to it on XBox but found that difficult to play because I just don't have a feel for modern gaming console controllers.  But after I starting playing on PC I was hooked.  I bought Portal 2 and now I'm in love.  This is such a big win when you have a game that appeals to people who grew up playing modern games as well as people who played less complicated games.  The humor in this game is fantastic also.
Nice cinematic experience, but the puzzles can be solved via potato.

Para quem gostou do portal 1, e ficou ou não decepcionado porque não ganhou o bolo. Não tem problema, porque nesta continuação você também NÃO vai vê-lo!! rsrs Tô de sacanagem.
Esse é um excelente jogo, com uma história muito boa, cheia de reviravoltas e o melhor é que não é limitado apenas as salas de testes, em determinadas partes do jogo você sai para um cenário externo, e é realmente muito bom. É uma viagem. Vale a pena jogar a campanha até o final que por sinal é muito divertido. 
O Coop também é muito bom, e pode render umas boas horas de passatempo. 
Recomendo 10/10.
Mt bom o jogo, Divertido e diferente. Um novo modo de ver jogos de estratégia.

Well, it's pretty hard to find anything bad to say about this game. I've played it somewhere else already before playing it on steam, but I know for sure that one day I'll go back playing this again.

The story of this game is funny and interesting, the graphics are awesome, the puzzles are varied and new (well working)mechanics have been added, and the world... it is huge and carries an absolutely undescribable atmosphere, in all the positive ways.

This game is nothing short of a masterpiece, and I enjoyed every minute I spent on it.
The best story for any game ever... Period
This game is the pinacle of both single player storytelling and co-op experience. I just can't explain it, other than saying I've had a blast...

Expands on everything that was excellent about the first Portal game, but as a much stronger plot line.  So far, more wandering around environments and less testing. Personally I like the test chambers, but this is still excellent fun with exactly the right level of challenge.

В добавок ко всему выше сказанному, хотел бы отметить веселый и увликательный кооператив, который принесет вам массу позитивных эмоции, играя с другом. Моя оценка 10/10 - Шедевр игровой индустрии! Всем рекомендую!

Portal 2 to kontynuacja niesamowicie wciągającej gry logicznej Portal. Wydana została przez studio Valve odpowiedzialne za takietyltuły jak Half Life czy Team Fortress. Po przejściu tego tytułu mogę wreszcie napisać chyba sensowną recencję. Zacznijmy od tego, że gre tę poleciłbym każdemu. Czemu? Mocny wątek fabularny wraz z ogromnymi mapami do eksplorowania zmieszany z trybem gry logicznej daje niezły mętlik w głowie. Po paru godzinach gry stajesz się znudzony, jednak tak jak by na życzenie dzieje się coś nowego co wciąga Cię do dalszej gry. W produkcji wcielamy się w ostatniego żywgo człowieka próbując uciec z placówki badawczej Aperture Science. W tej części nasz odwieczny wróg GLaDOS staje się naszym sprzymierzeńcem gdy w nieoczekiwanym zwrocie akcji zdradza nas nasz przyjaciel rdzeń Wheatley. W tym tytule nie brakuje niczego co powinno zakłócić rozgrywkę. Ukryte Easter Eggi wprawiają grającego w strach ale fabuła gry podpowiada Ci abyś śmialo szedł na przód. Wyposażony jedynie w przenośne działo 2 portalowe dumnie kroczysz przez komory testowe oraz opuszczone części budynku. Samo przejście tytuły nie jest łatwe ponieważ jest to piekielnie trudne nawet jeśli nie mamy tu wielu przeciwników. A to tylko pierwsza część gry. Po ukończeniu trybu jednoosobowego możemy zagrać ze znajomymi w tryb kooperacyjny wcielając się w dwa roboty twórców naukowców z Aperture. Tryb coop to zupełnie nowe poziomy i urozmaicona rozgrywka. Mimo to znajdę jeden błąd i problem w tej grze. Grafika. Bowiem silnik Source jest już trochę przestarzały i o ile tekstury są bardzo ładne to niestety shadery (testowane na najwyższych ustawieniach) są nieudane i widać w nich wyraźnie piksele. Ten mały problem nie przeszkadza jednak w grze. Podsumowując gra jest naprawdę świetna. Pozdrawiam.

It's a sequel to a classic Valve title. It's got co-op. And a whole pile of chapters..

Why wouldn't anyone want this? The puzzles are pretty nice - often improving where the original game failed - and there's about 3-4x the content the original had. The graphics are very improved, still feeling comparable in beauty to many of the 2014 releases we're familiar with.

The workshop support really gets to me. Yeah, you can make a whole pile of really nice looking chambers, fully functioning. ..But they're all big, open boxes in plain new aperture theme. They lack the aesthetics that make Portal 2.. Portal 2. Every single wall or floor is just a box. There's not really a lot you can do with it, and it's alright for blocking out before you open it in Hammer.. Which makes a lot of the workshop submissions - even top rated ones - look shoddy unless they go through the full effort of making it within the Hammer editor.

Overall though? 8/10
Excellent valve title. Anyone who doesn't already have this title though probably won't ever.

This game is one of the few games which when i look at a test makes my brain hurt, the hilarious lines from the various characters make me replay levels to hear them again, i havenot finished it yet but so far it has been worth every penny!

This game is all around outstanding, with an amazingly deep story line, local or online multiplayer, and full controller support  there is no reason for anybody who's played the first portal to not play this amazing sequel.

I would recommend you play through the first game before playing this one.

Sehr gutes Puzzelspiel mit einem sehr hohen Niveau über die gesamte Spielzeit. Die Rätsel sind sehr fair gestalltet und dank der   vorbildlicher Lernkurve ist man auch nicht überfordert. Durch den Humor und beißendem Sarkasmus (besonders von GLaDOS) müsste ich mehrmals während dem Spielen lachen. Der Koopmodus ist auch sehr empfehlenwert und hat genau die selben Stärken wie der Einzelspielermodus. Deshalb ist dieses Spiel eine absolute Empfehlung wert.

More Reviews @ TheVideogameBacklog.com

So it’s been a while since my buddy and I did our co-op run for Portal 2 on my Twitch stream. We had our fun and solved the puzzles all while we gathered achievements even though I’m not the biggest fan of them. I also had my fair share of screwing my buddy over by flipping a switch or not and getting rid of portals at the “right” time. Fun was had (at my buddy’s or my personal expense) and I figured I should now probably tackle the single player campaign.

The story carries over from the first. You’re the same woman (Chell) and I believe you’ve been in stasis for 50 years. You still look as good as you did when you killed GLaDOS those many years ago. The story wakes you to a new player in the Portal universe: Wheatley. Wheatley is hilarious! I love the banter that goes on (I would say between you and him, but you don’t really talk) as he “narrates” the goings-on.

Warning: the rest of the review contains what someone could consider a spoiler even if it’s a mild one (just in case you’re like me and up to this point haven’t actually played Portal 2 yet).

The story evolves and you eventually come to the realization that GLaDOS was killed, but she wasn’t erased when you accidentally bring her back online thanks to Wheatley’s “help”. What then ensues is a back and forth comedy, loads of puzzles, and a few great twists and realizations that, while not Earth shattering, is very interesting Portal trivia to know. The story was very fun and if you don’t feel the need to get through it, I can’t understand where you’re coming from.

They introduce a few new elements as well to help differentiate Portal 2 from the first. There a gels that get splattered around certain levels that can help the player run faster, jump higher or even create new surfaces to put a portal on. This really added a new level of thinking for the sequel. Also, there are tractor beams (as shown in the picture below), light bridges (which were super fun in co-op) and laser redirection cubes to, you know… that redirect lasers and such (or kill a buddy).

The co-op is as fun as the single player. You miss out on the banter between Wheatley and GLaDOS, but if you feel the need to be called not as good as your friend and then have GLaDOS sing your praise and tear down your friend or sometimes just both of you at the same time, co-op has it all! That, and the puzzles require more thinking than normal since the two of you both have portal guns and you’ll have to work them in tandem with the usual timing and well thought out plans.

Score: Tasty!

Portal 2 is the perfect evolution from its’ predecessor. The puzzles are about on par with the first game as far as difficulty where some you’ll just walk through while others will have you scratching your head for a while. In case you love them, Portal 2 has enough achievements for the hunters (and enough for people like me to just give up on getting them all). With the fantastic humor in the solo campaign and the very well thought out puzzles for co-op, Valve did a great job with this sequel. The only lament that I’ve got is that Valve doesn’t tend to make trilogies (even though I can’t figure out how they would progress from this point). I guess they could do something with more of the co-op stuff… four player Portal anyone?

The second best game in my history of gaming, only second to Fallout 2. And that is exclusively only because it was too short for my liking! I would have liked to play Portal 2 for dozens of more hours! It is simply incredibly good! Even the annoying sidekick is a funny character!

mean white woman makes you do things or else you lose your job

Portal 2, uno (por no decir el que mas) de los juegos mas originales a los que he jugado. Es COMPLETAMENTE diferente a cualquier juego de hoy en dia, tiene buena história, una buena jugabilidad, es sencillamente un juego en el que me he reido, lo he pasado mal, me he puesto nervioso, me he estresado, me he llenado de orgullo y satisfacción al completar una cámara dificil... de todo un poco vamos. 
Es toda una obra de arte, aunque siempre se base en lo mismo, crear portales y atravesarlos, nunca se hace aburrido.

Es prácticamente el juego perfecto, eso sin hablar del co-op, ya sabemos que todo es mucho mas divertido con un colega, y el multijugador te invita a rejugar el juego con una historia diferente a la principal, y cámaras únicas, en las que sin la cooperación de ambos jugadores, sería imposible completarlas.

Que mas se puede pedir? Portal 2 no es un juego, es EL juego.
